stream_context.summary: Kaze works shirt-less in summer heat, focusing on Bozo’s Oil Rig.  Main tasks are fixing wet-cement footprint code, texturing a Koopa construction NPC, and brainstorming an oil-rig re-skin for the Toxbox obstacle while discussing overworld economy plans and crash/performance issues.

development_findings.summary: Implemented ground-pound and dive ‘butt-print’ system for wet cement using I4 textures; fixed an indexing bug that affected every other footprint by duplicating the missing J offset code.
development_findings.quote: Oh my god. That part was missing everywhere. No wonder this didn't work.

development_findings.summary: Added a subtle rainbow outline to the Collect Star, inspired by Super Mario Sunshine.
development_findings.quote: Yeah, I added a little rainbow around it too. This is kind of stolen from Mario Sunshine.

development_findings.summary: Created Koopa construction-worker NPC: new helmet with Bowser logo, tired eyes, work boots, variable shell color; compiled required animation list and handed off to Zeina.
development_findings.quote: Man he looks so good in game. Actually. I like this guy a lot.

development_findings.summary: Planned Bozo’s Oil Rig hazards: fenced cement pit watched by the Koopa, and Toxboxes reimagined as shipping-container cubes with symmetrical faces.
development_findings.quote: You could redesign them as large shipping containers or mechanical cubes…

development_findings.summary: Settled on overworld economy: global coins buy helper power-stars, allow donations that visibly change the hub, and purchase Yoshi coins, reaching consensus after debates with Biobak.
development_findings.quote: I think we've come to a pretty good agreement.

development_findings.summary: Observed frequent N64 hardware crashes; needs better emulator diagnostics before release.
development_findings.quote: Dude, I'll be honest, I tested the game on N64 and while it runs super well when it runs, there's still a lot of crashes…

development_findings.summary: Wrote an optimized atan2S routine (‘SIG A10s2S’); peers compared it to academic paper quality.
development_findings.quote: I accidentally made a state-of-the-art programming code, I think.

development_findings.summary: Encountered what appears to be a legitimate GCC linkage bug; workaround found after recompiling.
development_findings.quote: That is a legitimate GCC bug.

development_findings.summary: Considering hosting ‘AF3’ fangame convention after conference obligations are done.
development_findings.quote: I'm thinking that maybe tomorrow I will announce an F3 actually happening.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s coding philosophy is purely functional: aesthetics are irrelevant if the compiler doesn’t care.
context_findings.quote: If the compiler doesn't see a difference, I also don't see a difference.

context_findings.summary: Working environment is sweltering; no AC, shirt-less, ceiling fan only.
context_findings.quote: I am basically just fucking dying right now from all the heat.

context_findings.summary: Views streaming platform choice pragmatically; left Twitch over excessive ads and dislikes YouTube’s high latency.
context_findings.quote: Twitch is just spamming so many ads that I just can't deal with it anymore.

context_findings.summary: States he earns modestly from ROM hacks and could make far more with his skills elsewhere but prefers the work.
context_findings.quote: I would make a lot more money if I just did literally anything else with my skills.

biobak.summary: Debated overworld redesign details with Kaze in DMs and reached a compromise.
biobak.quote: I've had some arguments with Biobak and… I think we've come to a pretty good agreement.

zeina.summary: Provided Mario butt-print sprite used for cement footprints.
zeina.quote: I'm pretty sure Zayna sent me the butt print.

zeina.summary: Will animate Koopa construction worker; received detailed list of required animations from Kaze.
zeina.quote: Animation list: idle, talk, angry, carrying glass, upset, walk, fall/slide.

zeina.summary: Supplied full Wario animation set to Kaze for future use.
zeina.quote: I also sent you all of Wario's animations.

key_stories.title: Footprint Bug Hunt
key_stories.summary: Cement footprints rendered incorrectly, alternating between proper circles and broken blobs. Kaze traced it to missing code handling for even-pixel addresses.
key_stories.challenge: Every other butt-print appeared corrupted in the cement.
key_stories.process: Inspected texture math, realized a J offset loop was absent, duplicated code for both odd and even pixels, and retested repeatedly.
key_stories.outcome: Footprints now render consistently and darken correctly; cement mechanic considered finished.
key_stories.key_quote: Oh my god. That part was missing everywhere. No wonder this didn't work.

key_stories.title: Building the Koopa Foreman
key_stories.summary: To contextualize the cement gimmick, Kaze designed a weary construction Koopa complete with Bowser-branded hardhat and tired eyes, collaborating live with Zeina for animations.
key_stories.challenge: Needed an NPC that reacts believably when Mario ruins fresh cement.
key_stories.process: Re-used Koopa model, created new textures in GIMP, adjusted UVs, selected work-boot colors, and compiled an animation spec.
key_stories.outcome: Finished model placed in level; animation work outsourced to Zeina.
key_stories.key_quote: Man he looks so good in game. Actually. I like this guy a lot.

key_stories.title: Overworld Economy Debate
key_stories.summary: Kaze and Biobak sparred over how players spend coins in the hub; they finally aligned on a store offering helper power-stars, donations that visibly upgrade the overworld, and collectible Yoshi coins.
key_stories.challenge: Design an overworld progression system that rewards exploration without alienating skilled players.
key_stories.process: Private Discord discussions, weighing accessibility vs. challenge, brainstorming purchasable items.
key_stories.outcome: Consensus reached; system will be prototyped next.
key_stories.key_quote: I think we've come to a pretty good agreement.

open_questions.context: Kaze reports frequent N64 crashes despite good framerate and lacks tools to trace them.
questions: What specific crash logs or patterns have been observed on hardware?
Which parts of the engine are suspected culprits, and what is the debugging plan?
Are there community or custom emulator tools being explored to assist?

open_questions.context: Kaze is unsure of release date and mentions distributing only a patch if Nintendo allows.
questions: What steps remain before a public release candidate?
Has Nintendo ever contacted the team, and how will legal risk be mitigated?
Will the patch-only distribution be enough to avoid takedowns?

open_questions.context: A coin-based store with power-stars and donation mechanics was outlined, but no technical details provided.
questions: How will item pricing and balancing work?
Will purchases affect difficulty or speed-running goals?
How will overworld visual changes be tracked and saved?

open_questions.context: Kaze plans to reskin Toxboxes as metal shipping containers with faces, but final design and functionality are undecided.
questions: Will their movement patterns change on the Oil Rig?
How will the new textures affect performance?
Is there thematic storytelling tied to these ‘container’ enemies?

open_questions.context: Kaze is ‘50-50’ on announcing AF3 now that other obligations are handled.
questions: What is the goal and format of AF3?
How will Return to Yoshi’s Island feature in the event?
What resources or collaborators are needed to make AF3 happen?

open_questions.context: Kaze briefly mentions multiplayer being a consideration when optimizing models.
questions: Is true co-op planned, and how will it be integrated technically on N64?
What compromises (polycounts, memory) are required to support it?
Who is leading multiplayer networking or split-screen work?
